metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26978 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpage could have exposed both an internal network's hosts as well as services running on the user's local machine. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
